question: Which tense is used to describe actions that started in the past and are still relevant now?
Fill in the blank: She _______ (finish) her homework already.
Past perfect tense is formed using 'will have' + past participle. (True / False)
Which sentence uses future perfect tense correctly?
options: I will finish my chores by dinner time.
I will have finished my chores by dinner time.
I have finished my chores by dinner time.
I had finished my chores by dinner time.

question: Fill in the blank: By the time I got home, my dog _______ (eat) all the food.
Which tense is used to describe actions that will be completed by a certain time later?
Present perfect tense always uses 'have' for all subjects. (True / False)
Fill in the blank: By next year, I _______ (learn) how to ride a bike.
Which sentence uses present perfect tense correctly?
options: I have went to the park yesterday.
She has gone to the park three times this week.
They have go to the park every day.
We has been to the park last month.

question: Fill in the blank: Before the teacher arrived, the students _______ (complete) their assignments.
Future perfect tense uses 'had' + past participle. (True / False)
Which tense is used to describe actions that were completed before another action back in the day?
Fill in the blank: They _______ (visit) five countries so far.
Present perfect tense can be used to talk about experiences. (True / False)
Which sentence uses past perfect tense correctly?
options: I had eaten lunch before I went to the meeting.
She has eaten lunch before she went to the meeting.
They will have eaten lunch before they go to the meeting.
We have had eaten lunch before we went to the meeting.

question: Fill in the blank: By the time you wake up tomorrow, I _______ (leave) for work.
Past perfect tense can also be used to describe future actions. (True / False)
Which tense is used to describe actions that started in the past and continue to the present?
Fill in the blank: She _______ (never/see) a real elephant before her trip to the zoo.
Future perfect tense always uses 'will have' for all subjects. (True / False)
Which sentence uses present perfect tense correctly?
options: She have seen that movie before.
We have lived here for five years.

question: Fill in the blank: By the end of this month, we _______ (save) enough money for our vacation.
Present perfect tense always refers to a specific time in the past. (True / False)
Which tense is used to show which of two previous actions happened first?
Fill in the blank: The movie _______ (already/start) when we arrived at the theater.
